poem:
Title: "A Song Sung in Weft"

Swift in Scottish threads she threads,
Between sunbaked stones of Brooklyn's hearts.
Lively, and Kravitz her starlit escorts,
Under Lucali's lamplit arches, they dart.

Gobsmacked, the weaver in Perth doth stand,
Her tapestry worn on global stage,
Sewn in Olive-green, a simple command,
Bought cheaply, but worn by the sage.
